question: Which country has approved its second coronavirus vaccine named 'EpiVacCorona'?
explanation:
Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the launch of a second coronavirus vaccine after early-stage studies.
The Russian authorities have given regulatory approval to the peptide-based vaccine named ‘EpiVacCorona’ after early-stage studies, developed by the Vector Institute in Siberia. The President also announced that the priority was to supply vaccines to the Russian market.
